metadata.title: CVE-2018-10926 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in RPC request using gfs3_mknod_req supported by glusterfsserver. An authenticated attacker could use this flaw to write files to anarbitrary location via path traversal and execute arbitrary code on aglusterfs server node.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10926` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-client - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-common - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-server - 4.1.4-1
libgfapi0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfchangelog0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfrpc0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfxdr0 - 4.1.4-1
libglusterfs0 - 4.1.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.4-1').
